post: At the Bill of Rights Institute, we teach civicsand we are proud to equip students and teachers to live the ideals of a free and just society. In this video, Anthony Simone, Vice President of Development at the Bill of Rights Institute, discusses the importance of supporting BRI's work. You can watch the full video below:  https://lnkd.in/egGH5Y_2 If you'd like to donate, please visit  https://lnkd.in/ePsJtSJy  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civiceducation

Huddle Up, a leading advocate for childrens growth, development, and mental health, is sponsoring our MyImpact Challenge Contest! As we celebrate Mental Health Month, we celebrate the organizations' shared commitment to support young people's well-being.  https://bit.ly/BRIMIC

May is National Military Appreciation Month  and New Mexico teacher Juan Armijo reminds us that our military members and veterans can be wonderful classroom resources. Armijo, a member of the Bill of Rights Institute National Teacher Council, shares how a World War II veteran helped his students gain a greater understanding of civics, history, and service. To read Armijos story, just click below.  https://lnkd.in/ey3h-ja5  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MillitaryAppreciationMonth

Huddle Up, a leading advocate for childrens growth, development, and mental health, is sponsoring our MyImpact Challenge Contest! As we celebrate Mental Health Month, we celebrate the organizations' shared commitments to supporting young people's well-being.  https://bit.ly/BRIMIC To learn more, visit  https://lnkd.in/eata2HEf  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Do you know a student who should participate in MyImpact Challenge? MyImpact Challenge Deadline: Sunday, May 19! Heres what you need to submit a project: - a current or active civics or service-based project - an essay of up to 1,200 words describing how your project exudes one of BRIs Civic Virtues or Founding Principles SUBMIT NOW:  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #myimpactchallenge

Deeply grateful to Michael Duhr (Foote Printing) and John Helline (BINDTECH) for their generosity and support of students in the great state of Ohio. Because of their support, thousands of students will now have printed pocket constitutions. If you would like to help support your own state or city for the Power of the Printed Word Initiative, please message me on LinkedIn :) Let's show the entire country how amazing the graphic arts community is!  #Printing  #Binding  #Civics  #Constiution  #GraphicArts  #Liberty

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to highlight our high-quality content  including stories of great courage throughout American history. In this episode of the nationally syndicated Our American Stories, BRIs Sr. Director of Content Kirk Higgins tells the story of the courageous 1961 Freedom Riders, who faced down hate, harassment, and violent mobs in a struggle for equality. To listen to the episode, visit  https://lnkd.in/eWF_NZRh.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI

What if Americas 250th birthday became a unifying time for our nation? And could a renewed focus on our Founding principles help bring Americans together? These are some of the questions Bill of Rights Institute President and CEO David Bobb tackles in his newest op-ed, "America's 250th is worthy of celebration  and unity.  As America's 250th approaches, Bobb discusses how the event can be a time for our nation to reflect on its journey, and for Americans to find common ground. "Americas journey has not been perfect, but our end goal  the full realization of equality and liberty for all people  is perfect,  Bobb wrote, adding that, As we prepare for Americas 250th birthday, we can celebrate the Founding principles that established a framework for both our journey and our progress.  To read more, visit  https://lnkd.in/eYPTe9sq.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #Foundingprinciples

The Bill of Rights Institute shared the perspectives of some of its National Teacher Council members on how they teach civics in their classrooms during this year's Teacher Appreciation Week. Visit  https://lnkd.in/ey3h-ja5 to learn how a "World War II Veteran Helped This BRI Teacher Council Member Teach Civics."  #billofrightsinstitute  #teacherappreciationweek  #WorldWarII

The Bill of Rights Institute's Teacher Fellowship applications are open! Applications for the Inaugural Class of the BRI Teacher Fellowship are due June 1, 2024. The Fellowship is a 9-month initiative aimed at empowering educators to deepen their understanding of civics and civic education through philosophical inquiry and innovative teaching methods. Interested in learning more? Visit  https://lnkd.in/ej_Q6Xgs.  #billofrightsinstitute  #teacherfellowship  #applications
